data.title: Local Programming — KHEN LP 106.9
data.text:
Monday

Sunny Side Up Dennis Kapela

8 - 9 AM

KHEN’s live morning music show.

Coot’s Old Time Radio Show

Dennis Kapela 9 - 10 AM

Dennis will take you back to the time when families sat around and listened to all types of radio shows. Tune in!

Bacon Lubbock Tomato Sandwich

Rick White

4 - 6 PM

Welcome to an hour exploration of the music born around Lubbock, TX. Beginning with “Buddy Holly” and using Lubbock’s “Walk of Fame” as a guide through the heart of TX. From there Rick will continue with other performers in the Country, Singer-songwriter, Americana genre.

Free Range Love

Deidre Wilda

7 - 9 PM

Explore two hours of Love songs - not just romantic love, but love of all kinds. Positivity in all forms, Love, Kindness and just being good to each other.

Tuesday

Sunny Side Up

Casey

8 - 10 AM

Sunny Side Up with Casey is a mix of music from the 50s and ’60s, all of it guaranteed to keep YOUR Sunny Side Up!

Crossing Borders

Slim Wolfe

10 AM - 12 PM (2nd & 3rd week of the Month)

Former host of “Foreign Affairs,” Slim has returned to KHEN for “Crossing Borders,” a two-hour excursion into traditional and contemporary musicians from around the world.

Good 4U Wellness

Alicia McLeod, MA, NHC

1:30 - 2 PM (alternating Tuesdays), encore 2:30 PM Sunday

Join Nutritional Health Coach Alicia and Ashley for discussions on a myriad of health-related topics derived from the classes taught at Natural Grocers.

We Are Chaffee - Looking UpstreamJon Pray and Adam Williams

2 - 3 PM

Join host Adam Williams and a diverse group of local guests sharing “human forward” conversations of personal challenges and experiences that shaped their lives. The hope is that sharing these stories will raise awareness and compassion within our community to create positive change in an “upstream”, proactive way. A true storytelling podcast, “Looking Upstream” is supported by the Colorado Public Health & Environment: Office of Health Equity.

Roll of the Dice II

Dave Ward

3 - 5 PM

Roll of the Dice II is the second go-'round of an eclectic music show popular before Covid 19. Dave twists and mixes up the genres while digging deep into his own collection to surprise and bewilder the listener (and himself!).

The Otter Hour

DJ Sage Mouse

5 - 6 PM

DJ Sage Mouse will keep you bumping heading home from work or off to the trails.

After Dinner Mint

Dutchess and The Royal Oui

6 - 8 PM

Sit back and relax with 2 hours of musical musings and ramblings on life. With themes ranging from love and the pursuit of freedom to money and corruption, After Dinner Mint is guaranteed to ignite your listening potential and soothe your sound receptors. So tune in and turn on your heart light. Your ears will thank you. We will too! This is the Soundtrack to your life.♥️

Wednesday

Sunny Side Up Fred Schubert

8 - 9 AM

KHEN’s live morning music show.

Art Matters

Naters

9 - 10 AM

Philosophical discussions about matters of importance to artists, art lovers, lovers of life, and other kindred spirits.

Salida Shred Files

Ethan Hedayat

10 AM - 12 PM

Ethan explores the vast expanse of 80’s and 90’s hard rock, and shares his experiences as a band guitarist and lead singer in Hollywood at that time.

DJ Duckie Doug’s No Disco Show

Doug Mendelson

1:30 - 4 PM

Classic rock not usually heard on the radio, theme rock from anti-war days, concert cuts, and festivals like Woodstock, Bangladesh, and Monterrey. As the name implies, no disco.

Greggae Riddims

DJ Greggae

4 - 6 PM

Greg takes listeners on a journey of reggae genres, with many shows featuring a unique theme, artist, or message.

Wolfman’s Round Up with Cat Wrangler

Wolfman Dave & Cat Wrangler 6 - 6:30 PM

Wolfman Dave and Cat Wrangler discuss everything from the weather in faraway places to the local fishing scene or what’s happening in NASCAR. You just never know where they’re gonna go next. Tune in and find out!

Big Wooly Music

Lisa Ledwith

7 - 9 PM

Lisa plays a variety of music, some jam band, bluegrass, classic rock, southern rock, folk, and alternative country. Every show follows a theme that Lisa has prepared.

Crummy StuffDJ DJ Burger King

10 PM - Midnight

Crummy Stuff RocknRoll Radio Showcase is storming the airwaves every Wednesday. From proto punk garage rock to crusty hardcore rippers to post-whatever-wave. C’mon and let’s bring the other noize!

Thursday

Sunny Side UpRick White

8 - 10 AM

KHEN’s live morning music show.

RMCR RoundUP

11 -11:30 AM

Join Maeve Conran of Rocky Mountain Community Radio as she shares news stories from around the Rocky Mountain area.

Tango with DvoraDvora Kanegis

1:30 - 2 PM

Featuring all types of tango music, from early tango through the golden age to contemporary and electronic tango. You will learn about the history of tango and hear interviews with the DJ’s teachers and musicians from all around the USA.

School Zone

Lisa Ledwith

Returning Fall 2024

Tune in for updates, interviews and goings on presented by our local schools here in Salida.

Poets and Minstrels

Barbara Ford

5 - 6 PM

A solid hour of user-friendly spoken poetry with several musical breaks. In one show there might be love poetry from Sappho, plus poetry from the rambunctious tribe of Colorado poets. Tune in and give poetry a chance.

Anything GoesWolf 6-8 PM

Longtime Blues fan and DJ, Wolf returns with an eclectic mix of music that you're going to love.

Vibe VendettaDJ TK 10 PM - Midnight

Local Salidan DJ TK brings a late-night, eclectic mix of genres from funk to rap, soul to electro vibes.
